From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

33.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
33.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

34.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
34.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
In need, needy, poor. From a compound of en and deo; deficient in.

34.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
34.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

34.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
34.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

34.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
34.str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.
A possessor, owner. From ktaomai; an owner.
A place, piece of land, field, property, estate. Diminutive of chora; a spot or plot of ground.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

34.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
34.str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.

34.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
34.str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

34.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Neuter Plural
34.str2: A reduplicated and prolonged form of prao; contracted from perao; to traffic, i.e. Dispose of as merchandise or into slavery.

35.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
35.str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

35.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: From dia and didomi; to give throughout a crowd, i.e. Deal out; also to deliver over.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

35.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
35.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
From kata; and hos and tis; according to which certain thing, i.e. As far as.

35.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From the base of chraomai or chre; employment, i.e. An affair; also occasion, demand, requirement or destitution.

36.str2: Joseph, a proper name. Of Hebrew origin; Joseph, the name of seven Israelites.
From Leui; a Levite, i.e. Descendant of Levi.
A Cypriote, belonging to Cyprus. From Kupros; a Cyprian, i.e. Inhabitant of Cyprus.

From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.

36.str2: (a) To call (name) by a supplementary (additional, alternative) name, (b) mid: To call upon, appeal to, address.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.

36.str2: To translate (from one language into another), interpret. From meta and hermeneuo; to explain over, i.e. Translate.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

37.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
37.str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.

37.str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).

37.str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.

Money, riches, possessions. Something useful or needed, i.e. Wealth, price.
